instance.context:
Also emerging
beneath the cliffs of the narrows is the railway , resolutely maintaining a level contour despite all the difficulties of the terrain .

` Try that , " he recommended , setting it
beneath her arm .

He stood it
beneath the skylight just as he heard footsteps pounding up the stairs .

He chose four different coloured capsules and tucked them discreetly
beneath his plate .

Throwing down the last of the whisky with a shudder , she switched off the bedside lamp and burrowed down
beneath the covers , already aware that the alcohol was having an effect , sending tentacles of warmth through her veins .

She thought of crawling
beneath the vehicle 's metal-plated skirt , but one faceful of exhaust-heated mud was enough to discourage her .

Looking
beneath the carriage , I noticed that there was a machine needle caught and laying flat across the magnets .

His head was raised towards the sky and the loose folds of skin
beneath his chin stretched , like a condemned man offering his neck to the executioner 's blade .

The pavements glistened
beneath the yellow lamplight .

The Russian 's teeth gleamed
beneath his military moustache in a brief smile .

Her rich brown hair gleamed
beneath the widow 's veil ; the bone structure of her face was overlaid with a suitable pallor , but no outward sign of grief .

She twirled and swayed around the room in a slow dance , her skirt billowing and her long hair shining
beneath the bright lights .

The spaghetti sizzled in the saucepan , the toast flared
beneath the grill .

Aunt Emily fumbled
beneath her pillows and pulled out a small fat volume bound in red morocco .

A weather-stained postcard pinned
beneath the bell announced that it was not working , so Maltravers used the knocker .

He held my wrists in one hand as easily as a bunch of flowers and I was pinned
beneath his bulk .

She could feel her nipples hardening
beneath the touch of his fingers , and her body trembled almost uncontrollably .

He spoiled twice as much fruit as he ate by crushing the berries
beneath his clumsy feet in a mad rush from bush to bush .

It was led by Father Reynard , his russet gown now hidden
beneath a gold and scarlet cope .

Joseph was shrouded
beneath a grey , black-striped blanket , and rested his rifle across his saddle pommel .

The work has brought to life a number of fine frescoes which were concealed
beneath a thick layer of plaster .

Tensions soon simmered
beneath the impression of domestic harmony and marital bliss .

I was somewhere on the curve of prejudice ; aware of an anger I had not dealt with , simmering
beneath the surface , showing itself in bad dreams and disgruntled waking .

The damp rock and tangled trees and grass give the ghyll a forbidding atmosphere , and I am not disappointed when we emerge
beneath Crinkle Crags .

There were newspapers on a table , the story was on an open page and if Marshall had not closed the paper and pushed it
beneath others , Wickham 's curiosity would not have been aroused .

Hari felt him take her arm and lead her
beneath the overhanging trees .

He was in stained black trousers and an open shirt , and his chin was rapidly disappearing
beneath a growth of soft , curly hair .

It slipped into the water , disappeared
beneath the surface and , fifteen seconds later , bobbed up again and hopped back on to the rock .
